alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Franklin (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 02 at 5:28PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern New York, including the following counties, Clinton and Franklin. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 525 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms, with 4 to 7 inches of rain haven fallen. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area with multiple road closures reported by emergency services. ALthough the heaviest rain has ended, rivers and streams will continue to run high through this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bryants Mill, Burke, Chateaugay, Malone, Merrill, Churubusco, Earlville, Owls Head, Chasm Falls, Brainardsville, Whippleville, Burke Center, Wolf Pond, Harrigan, Duane Center, North Burke, Standish and Ellenburg Center. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
